content: It's an awesome way to watch movies, 3D and 2D.  I mean, it's like having an IMAX screen strapped to your head.  However, it needs some work.  There needs to be a few more features controllable by a gamepad/external keyboard, specifically the option to pass through the camera.  This feature is useless on a Google cardboard or similar because you have to touch the screen to use it...meaning you've taken the phone out anyway.    Since you can access the menu with a controller, you need to be able to see it when you have the player on with a headset.  There should be an option to bring up the menu in the 3D world similar to the video.  Also, all of the settings should be alterable with a controller, some aren't.  There needs to be a help feature (or even just an online wiki).  Most settings have no explanation (such as orientation provider) and a help file to explain them would be great.  There could also be some simple integration with the magnetic "button" on a Cardboard headset, such as calibrate when clicked.  The calibration is the thing that an average user would most use with the headset on, and it would be handy if you could do it with the magnet button.
Only complaint is that it keeps asking me to rate it after I already did.  Was 5 stars, going down to 4.
